sentences.sContent: Depending on the recidivism rate, the government will pay investors in the first bond a return of 7.5-13%—or nothing, if the promised improvement is not achieved.
sentences.sContent_eng: Depending on the recidivism rate, the government will pay investors in the first bond a return of 7.5-13%—or nothing, if the promised improvement is not achieved.
sentences.sCn: 根据不同的累犯率，政府将会支付给投资者们第一抵押债券7.5%-13%的回报——或者什么都没有，如果当初的改善承诺并没有达到。

sentences.sContent: The recidivism rates among those that have gone through the program have dropped 26 percent—a hopeful sign.
sentences.sContent_eng: The recidivism rates among those that have gone through the program have dropped 26 percent—a hopeful sign.
sentences.sCn: 通过这个计划，累犯率下降了26个百分点——这可是一个可喜的信号。

sentences.sContent: The program was very successful, with a much lower recidivism rate than the prison system, at far less cost to the taxpayers.
sentences.sContent_eng: The program was very successful, with a much lower recidivism rate than the prison system, at far less cost to the taxpayers.
sentences.sCn: 这种模式非常成功，累犯的比率比监狱系统要低得多，也为纳税人省了很多钱。
